content.description: A Theater, the gang is in the audience wating for a play of Joey’s to start.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh! Look! Look! Look! Look, there’s Joey’s picture! This is so exciting!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You can always spot someone who’s never seen one of his plays before. Notice, no fear, no sense of impending doom…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The exclamation point in the title scares me. (Gesturing) Y’know, it’s not just Freud , it’s Freud!
(The lights dim.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, shhh, shh. Magic is about to happen.
(The lights go up on the stage, Joey, as Freud, is talking to a female patient.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Vell, Eva, ve’ve done some excellent vork here, and I vould have to say, your pwoblem is qviiite clear. (He goes into a song and dance number.)

content.description: The Theater, the play has ended and everyone is applauding. As soon as the cast leaves, the gang all groan and sit down heavily.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God. I feel violated.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did anybody else feel they just wanted to peel the skin off their body, to have something else to do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross, ten o’clock.
content.parenthetical: staring at a woman across the room

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is it? Feels like two.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, ten o’clock .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There’s a beautiful woman at eight, nine, ten o’clock!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. Hel-lo!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s amazing! She makes the women that I dream about look like short, fat, bald men!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, go over to her! She’s not with anyone.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, and what would my opening line be? “Excuse me. Blarrglarrghh.”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, c’mon. She’s a person, you can do it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh please, could she be more out of my league? Ross, back me up here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He could never get a woman like that in a million years.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you, buddy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, oh, but y’know, you always see these really beautiful women with these really nothing guys, you could be one of those guys.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You could do that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’think?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh God, I can’t believe I’m even considering this… I’m very very aware of my tongue…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon! C’mon!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here goes. (He walks over to her but just stands there.)

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: …Yes?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi… um… okay, next word… would be… Chandler! Chandler is my name, and, uh…(He clears his throat noisily)…hi.

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: Yes, you said that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, yes I did, but what I didn’t say was what I was about to say, what I wanted to say was, uh… would you like to go out with me sometime, thankyou, goodnight. (He walks back to the others but she calls him back.)

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: Chandler?
(Joey enters from behind a curtain. The others all talk at once.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey! You’re in a play! I didn’t know you could dance! You had a beard!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whadja think?
(Pause)

content.speaker: All
content.text: …Hey! You’re in a play! I didn’t know you could dance! You had a beard!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: C’mon, you guys, it wasn’t that bad. It was better than that thing I did with the trolls, at least you got to see my head.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Saw your head. Saw your head.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She said yes!! She said yes!! (To Joey) Awful play, man. Whoah. (To All) Her name’s Aurora, and she’s Italian, and she pronounces my name ‘Chand-lrr’. ‘Chand-lrr’. I think I like it better that way. (To Joey) Oh, listen, the usher gave me this to give to you. (He fishes a card out of his pocket.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The Estelle Leonard Talent Agency. Wow, an agency left me its card! Maybe they wanna sign me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Based on this play ? …Based on this play!

content.description: Central Perk, everyone else is there as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, kids.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, ’cause this line is passion, and this is… just a line.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I can’t believe I’ve been here almost seven seconds and you haven’t asked me how my date went.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, right, right. How was your date, ‘Chand-lrr’?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It was unbelievable. I-I’ve never met anyone like her. She’s had the most amazing life! She was in the Israeli army…
(A flashback of Aurora and Chandler on their date in Central Perk is denoted by italics.)

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: …Luckily none of the bullets hit the engine block. So, we made it to the border, but just barely, and I- …I’ve been talking about myself all night long, I’m sorry. What about you? Tell me one of your stories.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright. Once I got on the subway, right, and it was at night, and I rode it all the way to Brooklyn… just for the hell of it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We talked ’til like two. It was this perfect evening… more or less.

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: …All of a sudden we realised we were in Yammon.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry, so ‘we’ is?

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: ‘We’ would be me and Rick.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who’s Rick?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who’s Rick?

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: My husband.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ooooohhh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, so you’re divorced?

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry, then you’re widowed?…Hopefully?

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: No, I’m still married.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So tell me, how do- how do you think your husband would feel about you sitting here with me?…Sliding your foot so far up my pant leg you can count the change in my pocket?

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: Don’t worry. I imagine he’d be okay with you because really, he’s okay with Ethan.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ethan? There’s, there’s an Ethan?

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: Mmmm… Ethan is my… boyfriend.

content.speaker: All
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So explain something to me here, uh, what kind of a relationship do you imagine us having if you already have a husband and a boyfriend?

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: I suppose mainly sexual.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …Hm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. I’m sorry it didn’t work out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What ‘not work out’? I’m seeing her again on Thursday. Didn’t you listen to the story?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Didn’t you listen to the story? I mean, this is twisted! How could you get involved with a woman like this?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, y’know, I had some trouble with it at first too, but the way I look at it is, I get all the good stuff: all the fun, all the talking, all the sex; and none of the responsibility. I mean, this is every guy’s fantasy!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah. That is not true. Ross, is this your fantasy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, of course not! (Thinks) …Yeah, yeah, it is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? So you guys don’t mind going out with someone else who’s going out with someone else?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I couldn’t do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Good for you, Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: When I’m with a woman, I need to know that I’m going out with more people than she is.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, y’know, monogamy can be a, uh, tricky concept. I mean, anthropologically speaking-
(They all pretend to fall asleep.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine. Fine, alright, now you’ll never know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re kidding. C’mon, tell us!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah! C’mon!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright. There’s a theory, put forth by Richard Leakey-
(They all fall asleep again.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is there as enter except Joey enter.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Tah-daaah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are we greeting each other this way now? ’Cause I like that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look! I cleaned! I did the windows, I did the floors… I even used all the attachments on the vacuum, except that little round one with the bristles, I don’t know what that’s for.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah, nobody knows. And we’re not supposed to ask.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, whaddya think?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Very clean! It looks great! Terrific!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: …Oh! I-I see you moved the green ottoman.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Uh-oh…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How-how did that happen?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I dunno.. I-I thought it looked better there. And I- and also, it’s an extra seat around the coffee table.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, yeah, it’s interesting.. but y’know what? Just for fun, let’s see what it looked like in the old spot. (She moves it.) Alright, just to compare. Let’s see. Well, it looks good there too. Let’s just leave it there for a while.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe you tried to move the green ottoman.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank God you didn’t try to fan out the magazines. I mean, she’ll scratch your eyes right out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You guys, I am not that bad!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, you are, Monica. Remember when I lived with you? You were like, a little, y’know, (psycho) Ree! Ree! Ree! Ree!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is so unfair!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh c’mon! When we were kids, yours was the only Raggedy Ann doll that wasn’t raggedy!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, so I’m responsible, I’m organised. But hey, I can be a kook.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, you madcap gal. Try to imagine this. The phone bill arrives, but you don’t pay it right away.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because you’re a kook! Instead you wait until they send you a notice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I could do that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, uh, you let me go grocery shopping, and I buy laundry detergent, but it’s not the one with the easy-pour spout.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why would someone do that?! …One might wonder.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Someone’s left a glass on the coffee table. There’s no coaster. It’s a cold drink, it’s a hot day. Little beads of condensation are inching their way closer and closer to the surface of the wood…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: STOP IT!! …Oh my God. It’s true! Who am I?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica? You’re Mom.
(Monica gasps.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ree! Ree! Ree! Ree! Ree!
(Joey enters and he’s on the phone.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh huh.. uh huh… oh my God! Okay! Okay, I’ll be there! (He hangs up and to all.) That was my agent. (He tosses and catches the phone.) My agent has just gotten me a job…in the new Al Pacino movie!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh my God! Whoah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, what’s the part?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can you believe this? Al Pacino! This guy’s the reason I became an actor! ”I’m out of order? Pfeeeh. You’re out of order! This whole courtroom’s out of order!”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Seriously, what-what’s the part?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: “Just when I thought I was out, they pull me back in!”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon, seriously, Joey, what’s the part?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …I’m his (mumbles)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: ..You’re, you’re ‘mah mah mah’ what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …I’m his butt double. ’kay? I play Al Pacino’s butt. Alright? He goes into the shower, and then- I’m his butt.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: C’mon, you guys. This is a real movie, and Al Pacino’s in it, and that’s big!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no, it’s terrific, it’s… it’s… y’know, you deserve this, after all your years of struggling, you’ve finally been able to crack your way into showbusiness.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, okay, fine! Make jokes, I don’t care! This is a big break for me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re right, you’re right, it is…So you gonna invite us all to the big opening?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the next morning, Monica is getting the door.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, alright, alright…
(Joey enters with Monica’s paper and hands it to her.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here. I need to borrow some moisturizer.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: For what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whaddya think? Today’s the big day!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God. Okay, go into the bathroom, use whatever you want, just don’t ever tell me what you did in there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you! (He goes into the bathroom.)
(Chandler enters with the phone.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where’s Joey? His mom’s on the phone.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s in the bathroom. I don’t think you wanna go in there!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: C’mon, we’re roommates! (He goes into the bathroom, screams, and runs back out.) My eyes!! My eyes!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I warned you…
(Rachel enters from her room.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who is being loud?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that would be Monica. Hey, listen, I wanna borrow a coupla things, Aurora spent the night, I really wanna make her breakfast.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you got the whole night, huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well, I only have twenty minutes until Ethan, so, y’know.. (He starts to raid the fridge.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, do I sense a little bit of resentment?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no resentment, believe me, it’s worth it. ’kay? Y’know in a relationship you have these key moments that you know you’ll remember for the rest of your life? Well, every- single- second is like that with Aurora.. and I’ve just wasted about thirty-five of them talking to you people, so, uh.. Monica, can you help me with the door? (He has armloads of stuff.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sure. Oh, um, Chandler? Y’know, the-the old Monica would-would remind you to scrub that Teflon pan with a plastic brush…But I’m not gonna do that.
(She opens the door and he leaves.)

content.description: A Film Set, Joey is entering for his scene.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: …Dammit, hire the girl! (He hangs up the phone.) Okay, everybody ready?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, listen, I just wanna thank you for this great opportunity.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Lose the robe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me?

content.speaker: Director
content.text: That would work.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right. Okay. Losing the robe. (He takes off the robe.) And the robe is lost.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Okay, everybody, we’d like to get this in one take, please. Let’s roll it.. water’s working (The shower starts).. and… action.
(Joey starts to the shower with a grim, determined look on his face.)

content.speaker: Director
content.text: And cut. Hey, Butt Guy, what the hell are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’m- I’m showering.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: No, that was clenching.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. Well, the way I see it, the guy’s upset here, y’know? I mean, his wife’s dead, his brother’s missing… I think his butt would be angry here.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: I think his butt would like to get this shot before lunch. Once again, rolling… water working… and action…and cut. What was that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I was going for quiet desperation. But if you have to ask…

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Aurora and Chandler are in bed in Chandler’s room.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: God, I love these fingers…

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, actually I meant my fingers. Look at ’em, look at how happy they are.

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: Oh my God, I’m late. (She starts to get up.)
content.parenthetical: moves Chandler’s arm and look at his watch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no nonononononnononono, don’t go.. (He kisses her and pulls her back down.)

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t go.

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: Okay. Oh no, I have to.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Too bad, she’s leaving.

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: I’m sorry. He’ll be waiting for me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I thought- I thought you talked to Rick.

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: It’s not Rick.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What, Ethan? He got to spend the whole day with you!

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: No, it’s-it’s Andrew.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know there’ll be many moments in the years to come when I’ll regret asking the following question, but- And Andrew is?

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: He’s… new.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, so what you’re saying is you’re not completely fulfilled by Rick, Ethan and myself?

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: No, that’s not exactly what I was..

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, y’know, most women would kill for three guys like us.

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: So what do you want?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You.

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: You have me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nono, just you.

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: Whaddyou mean?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Lose the other guys.

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: …Like, …all of them?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: C’mon, we’re great together, why not?

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: Why can’t we just have what we have now? Why can’t we just talk, and laugh, and make love, without feeling obligated to one another… and up until tonight I thought that’s what you wanted too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …Well, y’know, part of me wants that, but it’s like I’m two guys, y’know? I mean, one guy’s going “Shut up! This is great!” But there’s this other guy. Actually it’s the same guy that wells up every time that Grinch’s heart grows three sizes and breaks that measuring device… And he’s saying, y’know, “This is too hard! Get out! Get out!”

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: So… which one of the two guys will you listen to?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know, I-I have to listen to both of them, they don’t exactly let each other finish…

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: Which one?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …The second guy.

content.speaker: Aurora
content.text: Well, call me if you change your mind.
(She kisses him, he holds her, and kisses her passionately.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry, the first guy runs the lips.
(She leaves, Chandler sighs, and falls back on his bed.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is trying to comfort Chandler. Joey is absent.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look at it this way: you dumped her . Right? I mean, this woman was unbelievably sexy, and beautiful, intelligent, unattainable… Tell me why you did this again?
(Joey enters.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, waitwait, aren’t you the guy that plays the butt in the new Al Pacino movie?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No? What happened, big guy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ‘Big guy?’

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It felt like a ‘big guy’ moment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I got fired.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, they said I acted too much with it. I told everybody about this! Now everybody’s gonna go to the theatre, expecting to see me, and…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Joey, you know what, no-one is gonna be able to tell.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: My mom will.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Something so sweet and…disturbing about that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know, I’ve done nothing but crappy plays for six years. And I finally get my shot, and I blow it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe this wasn’t your shot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I mean… I think when it’s your shot, y’know, you-you know it’s your shot. Did it… feel like your shot..?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hard to tell, I was naked.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I don’t think this was your shot. I mean, I don’t even think you just get one shot. I really believe big things are gonna happen for you, I do! You’ve gotta just keep thinking about the day that some kid is gonna run up to his friends and go “I got the part! I got the part! I’m gonna be Joey Tribbiani’s ass!”.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah? That’s so nice! (They hug.)
(Ross and Chandler look at each other and hug as well.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, Joey. I’m gonna go to bed, guys.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Night.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, Mon, you-you gonna leave your shoes out here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-huh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? Just casually strewn about in that reckless haphazard manner?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Doesn’t matter, I’ll get ’em tomorrow. Or not. Whenever. (He goes to her room.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She is a kook.

content.description: Monica’s Bedroom, she’s lying in bed wide awake.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If it bothers you that much, just go out and get the shoes. No. Don’t do this. This is stupid! I don’t have to prove anything, I’m gonna go get them…But then everyone will know. Unless I get them, and then wake up really early and put them back! …I need help! (She buries her head in her pillow.)
content.parenthetical: hums for a while, then gives up, and in her head
